subject: Learning
title: The Factory Model of Schooling
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Factory Model of Schooling.

hook.text: Bells ring. Students move in batches. Subjects change every 45 minutes. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: The industrial revolution needed a workforce that could follow schedules and take instructions.

discovery.text: Schools adopted factory principles: standardized inputs, batch processing, and quality control through exams.

twist.text: The model worked brilliantly for industrialization. But the economy has changedâ€”the model hasn't.

climax.text: Today's jobs demand creativity, collaboration, and critical thinkingâ€”none of which the factory model teaches well.

punchline.text: We educate for factories that no longer exist.

quiz.question: Why is the factory model of schooling criticized today?
options: It was designed for industrial compliance, not modern creative skills
It gives students too much freedom
